intro: Dorstenia hockii, commonly known as the Hockii False Fig, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central America and is characterized by its unique, spirally arranged leaves that resemble the shape of a fig. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Dorstenia hockii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires moderate to bright indirect light for optimal growth.
